admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund: TF037702-JORDAN - EXPORT DEVELOPMENT,TF032638-GLOBAL - INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY,TF031372-JORDAN - PRIVATE SECTOR EXPORT DEV.,TF029106-PHRD-EXPORT DEV. & PROJECT FINANCE

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and institutional development
            impacts are modest. Lessons stipulate that by and large, the
            economic environment determines the outcome of a project,
            namely through a combination of strong economic policies,
            economic growth, export demand, and the state and depth of
            the financial sector. Nonetheless, despite limitations on
            this account, a line of credit operation can have
            significant impacts on investment, employment, and foreign
            exchange earnings, due to the leverage it may exercise, and
            the institutional improvements it may induce. Several
            factors contributed to the success of the project: the
            specific objectives, and instruments of the project were
            narrowly focused on term finance, and the use of the line of
            credit; there was unmet demand for term finance; and,
            financially sound banks participated, giving adequate
            attention to sub-loans. However, the export development
            objective, in the absence of any targeting of sub-loans, had
            no essential link to the use of the credit line, which led
            to difficulties in project supervision, and in the Quality
            Assurance Group review. Thus, components, and performance
            indicators should be clearly linked, and consistent with
            each other at the time of entry. Furthermore, consideration
            should be given to adapting requirements prudently, and in
            accordance with private sector needs.
